text: I'm using Python v2.6 and I have a string which contains a number of punctuation characters I'd like to strip out.
Now I've looked at using the string.punctuation() function but unfortunately, I want to strip out all punctuation characters except fullstops and dashes.
In total, there are only a total of 5 punctuation marks I'd like to strip out - ()\"'
I'd like this to be the most efficient way.
